--- title: "QTM350 Assinment5: World Development Indicators Dataset(2020) Analysis" author: "XiPu Wang" date: "Oct.10 2024" format: html: default pdf: default bibliography: references.bib --- ## Question 3: Conduct exploratory data analysis on at least three indicators: ::: {#565777c1 .cell execution_count=2} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2} ```{=html}
gdp_per_capita inflation_rate unemployment_rate
count 203.000000 169.000000 186.000000
mean 20345.707649 12.493936 7.268661
std 31308.942225 19.682433 5.827726
min 259.025031 -6.687321 0.130000
25% 2570.563284 5.518129 3.500750
50% 7587.588173 7.967574 5.537500
75% 25982.630050 11.665567 9.455250
max 240862.182448 171.205491 37.852000
``` ::: ::: From the output above, we can see that for all countries, the mean GDP is 20345, with a mininum value 259.02. The median GDP for all countries is 7587.58, while the largest GDP is 240862.18. For inflation rate, the mean inflation is 12.49, with a standard deviation of 19.682. Among all countries, the lowest inflation is -6.68, the median inflation is 5.51, and the largest inflation is 171.205. For the unemployment rate, the average unemployment rate is 7.26%, with a 5.82 standard deviation. The lowest unemployment rate among all is 0.13%, the average unemployment rate is 5.53%, and the largest unemployment rate is 37.8%. ### Calculate the Correlation between life expectancy and GDP per capita ::: {#3e2939d8 .cell execution_count=3} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Pearson correlation coefficient: 0.64 ``` ::: ::: It turns out that the correlation coefficient is 0.64, which is quite strong, we will look this further through the graphs. ## Question 4: Create at least two different types of plots to represent the analysis. ### Top 10 Countries by GDP per Capita ::: {#cell-fig-gdp-bar .cell execution_count=4} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Top 10 Countries by GDP per Capita in 2022](Qtm350_Assinment5_files/figure-html/fig-gdp-bar-output-1.png){#fig-gdp-bar width=949 height=565} ::: ::: ### Life Expectancy vs. GDP per Capita ::: {#cell-fig-life-exp-scatter .cell execution_count=5} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Life Expectancy vs. GDP per Capita](Qtm350_Assinment5_files/figure-html/fig-life-exp-scatter-output-1.png){#fig-life-exp-scatter width=949 height=564} ::: ::: ## Question 5: Key Statistics Table ::: {#tbl-key-stats .cell tbl-cap='Key Statistics of Selected Indicators' execution_count=6} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6} ```{=html}
gdp_per_capita life_expectancy unemployment_rate
mean 20345.71 72.42 7.27
median 7587.59 73.51 5.54
std 31308.94 7.71 5.83
``` ::: ::: As shown in **Figure \@fig-gdp-bar**, the country with the highest GDP per capita is Refer to **Table \@tbl-key-stats** for a summary of key statistics. ## Conclusion: For contries, there is a quite strong positive correlatio between life expectancy and GDP per Capita. This theory is also supported by the paper referenced. (Goran Miladinov)
